questions.text: Radon exists in this form at standard temperature and pressure.
questions.explanation:
gas.

	At ordinary temperatures radon is a colorless gas, the heaviest known.

questions.text: Every square mile of soil to a depth of 6 inches has about this amount of radon.
Of the following isotopes of radon, which has the longest half-life?
questions.explanation:
Rn-222.

	Rn-222 has a half-life of 3.82 days, Rn-217's is 0.6 milliseconds, Rn-219's is 3.96 seconds, and Rn-220's is almost a minute.
